revised_title: X-ray Astronomy: Discoveries and Observations of the Galactic Centre
tldr: The author discusses recent findings in X-ray astronomy, focusing on the galactic center. Using data from the Ariel 5 satellite and a coded mask telescope, they discovered several burst and irregular variable X-ray sources near the galactic center. These findings provide insight into the active processes occurring in the nucleus of our galaxy and contribute to the understanding of X-ray astronomy.
